body:
When i test enable diskWeightBasedPlacement locally, standalone can't startup successful, the output log stoped at:

run java8 tests
run integration tests
@sijie Does the new implementation make sense?

@codelipenghui weight based placement policy requires configuring bookies to use v3 protocol. there are two options: 

1) make changes to managed ledger to allow using v3 protocol. so that you can use both.

or 

2) wait until we release bookkeeper 4.10. 4.10 will support a mixed mode of both v2 and v3. the release of bookkeeper 4.10 is under discussion.
@sijie Thanks, broker start succeed after set `bookkeeperUseV2WireProtocol=false` in broker.conf
@sijie The scene has been destroyed, I solved it by restart all brokers.
@Jennifer88huang Could you please spare some time to review it, thanks~
@sijie after restart all brokers, the all commonds are working corrected.

After reading PIP-33, and discussing with @zymap, we come to the conclusion that snapshot belongs to internal implementation, and users need not know it. If so, I'll not document how snapshot works in the user docs. If there is any misunderstanding, feel free to tell me.
Thing to be confirmed (@jiazhai @tuteng @zymap @merlimat) :   
- "The snapshots are taken periodically. Proposed default is every 1 second." "The frequency of this snapshot will be configurable in `broker.conf`" Is the snapshot set by default? Should we tell users the limitations?
- Is "replicated subscription" enabled by default? or Is the default value of `.replicateSubscriptionState` true or false?

@tuteng @zymap Could you please help review? Thank you.
There are things to be confirmed, see discussion in https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/5134

Shall we propagate the following info to users? If those are set by default, and user need not to configure or know the logic, we'll not add those info in user docs.
- snapshot solution
- maker messages
- construct cursor snapshot
- store snapshot
- update subscription in remote regions
When creating and closing a Pulsar client object repeatedly, the program may stop when the `ClientConnection` destructor is called. I don't know the cause yet...
